SEARCH
Package Src.Entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Src.Entity.Entity
Src.Entity.Player
public class Player extends Entity
The Player class represents a game character with movement and animation capabilities. It contains fields for handling animation frames, storing sprite images for different directions, and references to the game panel and key handler for input processing.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(GamePanel gp, KeyHandler keyH, TitleManager mapManager)
      Constructor for the Player class. Initializes a player object with the specified parameters, including the game panel, key handler, and title manager. Sets the initial position, size, and other properties of the player.
      Parameters:
      gp - The GamePanel instance to which the player belongs.
      keyH - The KeyHandler responsible for handling player input.
      mapManager - The TitleManager providing map-related functionality.

  • Method Details

    • InitPlayer

      public void InitPlayer()
      Initializes the player by creating sprite vectors, loading player images, and setting up initial parameters such as speed, sprite index, and collision area. Assumes the existence of player sprite images in specific directories.

    • getPlayerImage

      public void getPlayerImage()
      Loads player sprite images for different directions (front, back, left, right). Populates the respective vectors with image resources for animation.

    • Update

      public void Update()
      Updates the player's position and sprite based on user input and game logic. Handles movement in four directions (up, down, left, right) and sprite animation.

    • Draw

      public void Draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the player on the provided Graphics2D object.
      Parameters:
      g2 - The Graphics2D object on which the player will be drawn.
